ygData.subject: Re: A question on kill stealing.
ygData.msgSnippet: I never help unless I am asked to OR the person is most definitely losing OR after the person has done more than 50% damage to the beast.  Then I go hell for
ygData.messageBody:
I never help unless I am asked to OR the person is most definitely losing OR
after the person has done more than 50% damage to the beast. Then I go hell
for leather, and pull out so I dont get the last swing.

I also like using my bow to help someone without inflicting the majority of
damage.

Jaade,
Indigo Sista Soldier.

> ----------
> From: James Schuldes[SMTP:jgs@...]
> Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Sent: Monday, May 17, 1999 11:19 PM
> To: 'warriors_eq@onelist.com'
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] A question on kill stealing.
>
> From: James Schuldes <jgs@...>
>
> Greets Faderic!
>
> BB is a mad house sometimes.
>
> The situation you may want to watch out for is "helping" someone kill a
> mob
> when the person you are trying to "help" wants to do it solo for the xp.
> If
> you join a fight in progress, you may inflict more damage and get the kill
> and thus the other guy does not get the xp from the fight.
>
> What I do is target the mob and then target the other guy. Assess if he
> needs help by looking at the difference in hp - this may be the 2nd or 3rd
> mob he has been fighting and even though it's a scrawny, he maybe low on
> hp
> and would like some help.
>
> BB is where some people go for loot - others go there for the high MD.
> There are usually lots of kills laying around free for anyone to loot.
> And
> even some dead guards and elites just laying there waiting for the looters
> time to expire.
>
> If someone gets so bad with insults, I just go: "don't make me /ignore
> you!"
>
>
> Snyak.
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: schlaban yocksovik [mailto:anonymaste@...]
> Sent: Monday, May 17, 1999 9:02 AM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] A question on kill
> stealing.
>
> From: "schlaban yocksovik" <anonymaste@...>
>
> well if you saw the person that was hackin the mob die and
> you took over its
> your kill.
> And as far as im concerned, bb is a special case.
> The trains in there are worse then any other area I have
> ever seen.
> There are so many mobs there that if one gets killed or
> stolen its often not
> done with evil intentions but done to help someone.
>
> Yes most damage always count.
>
> Depending on class I would come up with a nifty comment.
> ingame insults always work
> ooc insults though is something I realy dont like.
> I would have just insulted him for being
> short/skinny/tall/ugly/weak/archmage wannabee, just
> anything.
>
> take care
>
> Vashi
>
>
>
> >From: Kelly Pruett <pruett@...>
> >
> >Hi all,
> >I've been a roleplayer and a mudder for years now. I've
> come to EQ like
> >most of us, with a lot of experience in multiplayer gaming.
> Now, I'm
> >fairly new to EQ (level 8) but I thought I had a good
> understanding of
> >it, and it's unwritten rules, until now.
> >
> >The other night I was in BlackBurrow in a small group of 3.
> Two of us
> >were at the bottom level, and I was up top, returning from
> a town run. I
> >saw a gnoll guardsman kill someone, so I ran up to take
> charge of it.
> >There was nobody else around it. After a few hits it fled
> to the lower
> >level with me chasing it every step, hacking and kicking.
> Upon reaching
> >the lower level, there was a mini train already down there,
> but both me,
> >and the members of my group, were working on the gnoll
> guardsman I had
> >chased down. Towards the end of the fight, a fighter type
> of some sort
> >walked up and took the final swing on the guardsman.
> Thinking I had done
> >it ( I had to scroll back to look afterward) I bent over
> and looted the
> >corpse.
> >
> >The fighter started complaining at once that I was a kill
> stealer and I
> >took his loot. I explained to him that I had chased the
> monster down,
> >and had done the most damage, and therefore the computer
> LET me take my
> >kill. He respnded that HE had chased the monster down from
> the top (I
> >never even saw anyone up top but myself) and had made the
> kill therefore
> >it wasn't mine to take. I didn't feel like the argument was
> worth it so
> >I gave up and tried to trade him the loot. He would not
> accept, but
> >instead complained to me via tells that he couldn't believe
> I did that.
> >
> >My questions are:
> >1.) Was I ethically wrong to take the loot?
> >2.) Does the game only allow the majority damage dealer to
> take the
> >loot, or the final swinger?
> >3.) How would you guys deal with this situation?
> >
> >Thanks for any advice ....
> >-Faderic of Qeynos (Ellorisi Marr server)
> >
> >
> >
>
